--- PAGE 82 ---

82 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Modulators4
NOTES4.2 Modulators
A modulator is the source which generates the parameter changes. A 
variety of modulators are available to select as the source. The destination 
will be any device or mixer parameter. Note that modulators are 
synchronised to the Play/Stop start control and to the global BPM.
The page displayed will reflect the modulator loaded. 
Example of the Modulation Structure
mod
mod
MOD 1 MOD 2 MOD 3 MOD 4
+
Modulators Hold [MOD] + Press Action Button to open the modulator page.
Press [SELECT] to open the modulator selection list.
Modulator Library
Destination Parameter
Speed Pitch Track 1
Modulation Amount
Destination Audio Device
(also the Mix page parameters can be the destination)
Wave Random Wave ADSR
PLAY / STOP CLOCK
MOD 1 MOD 2 MOD 3 MOD 4
Wave
Random
ADSR
â€¦
Modulation instances loaded to slots

--- PAGE 83 ---

83The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Modulators4
NOTES 4.2.1 Wave - Modulator
An LFO or Low Frequency Oscillator is a wave which cycles continuously at 
a defined rate. An LFO operates slower than an audio level oscillator and is 
used for modulation. The Wave modulator is a classic LFO with warping 
and morphing features to create complex and interesting shapes.
See Appendix for rate list
WAVE1 120.0 ê€“ ê€‘ê€
RATE ï¿½ AMOUNT PHASE OFFSET
SKEW FOLD CURVE SPREAD
SELECTê€† ê€ˆê€‡ ê€‰
Mod Hold [MOD] + Press Action Button to select modulator
Page 1/1
Parameter Knobs                                                                                           Page 1
Rate         ï¿½ Amount Phase Offset
Rate of modulation. 
Determines speed of 
the LFO cycles. Press 
+ Turn for mode.
Scale the amplitude of 
the LFO.
Adjusts the phase of 
the LFO cycles
Adjust the LFO Base 
offset.
Skew Fold Curve Spread
Tilts the LFO wave 
shape at either side.
Adjust the vertical 
wave folding amount.
Adjusts the incline 
and the shape of the 
wave curves.
Increases the â€˜stereoâ€™ 
modulation spread 
and phase of the dual 
curves.
Action Buttons
Select             ê€† ê€‡ ê€ˆ ê€‰
Open the modulator 
selection pop-up list.
Press [MOD] to select modulation mode on or off when 
on a destination parameter page.
Some parameters tagged ï¿½ offer a number of â€˜Mode 
Selectâ€™ options from a pop-up list. This can be accessed 
for some parameters by pressing the knob. Press and 
turn to select an item from the presented list.
Rate
Rate Mode
Straight
Dotted
Triplet
Free

--- PAGE 84 ---

84 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
NOTES
Modulators4
Complex and interesting shapes can be created with the Wave. The shape 
is affected by Skew, Fold and Curve while Offset, Amount and Phase affect 
the amplitude and position. Spread duplicates the wave to widen the stereo 
field of modulation. Rate is linked to time division synchronization and 
affects the speed of the oscillation cycle.
* Rate Interval options: 8/1, 4/1, 2/1, 1/1, 1/2, 1/4, 1/8, 1/16, 1/32, 1/64, 1/128
Rate
Phase
Offset
Amount
%
Skew Fold Curve
Create interesting wave shapes by 
combining the shaping parameters
Freely Assign or Straight fixed intervals *
Spread
Bipolar
Unipolar

--- PAGE 85 ---

85The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
NOTES
Modulators4
4.2.2 Random - Modulator
The Random function is a polymetric, stepped, random modulation shape 
with adjustable rate and smoothness. This modulator can be set to a 
repeatable random shape or to a continuously evolving random shape. 
Some parameters tagged ï¿½ offer a number of â€˜Mode 
Selectâ€™ options from a pop-up list. This can be accessed 
for some parameters by pressing the knob. Press and 
turn to select an item from the presented list.
RANDOM1 120.0 ê€“ ê€‘ê€
SELECTê€†
RATE ï¿½ AMOUNT PHASE OFFSET
SPREAD VARIATION SMOOTH LENGTH
SYNC OFF ê€ˆê€‡ ê€‰
Mod Hold [MOD] + Press Action Button to select modulator
Page 1/1
Press [MATERIAL] to select and cycle pagesParameter Knobs                                                                                           Page 1

Duration of a step *.

setting mode.

Select               ê€† Sync On/Off ê€‡ ê€ˆ ê€‰

On - Synchronises to

See Appendix for rate list
Rate
Rate Mode
Straight

Triplet

--- PAGE 86 ---

86 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
NOTES
Modulators4
Random operates either as a randomly generated â€˜fixedâ€™ shape or a 
continuously changing random shape. This is ideal for generative and 
evolving sounds.
A loop cycle can consist of between 1-32 steps in length, each step 
duration set by rate. If the â€˜Syncâ€™ is ON, the modulator automatically 
resynchronises to the global timeline when length or rate is changed to 
maintain the quantisation of the 1st beat.  If Sync is OFF the sequence runs 
freely with no reset when changing rate or length.
New random variations can be generated on each loop where each step 
level is adjusted iteratively. The amount of randomisation set by the 
variation parameter. Variation at 0% will set a fixed random shape cycle.
Based on Rate x Length
Freely Assign or Straight fixed intervals
Rate
Offset
Amount
%
Sync
On/Off
Length - No of Steps
1 32
Cycle 1 Cycle 2
Variation
Cycle 2 etc
Smooth
Bipolar
Unipolar
New random shape variations can be generated on each loop cycle or 
operate on a repeated fixed shape.
Spread

--- PAGE 87 ---

87The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
NOTES
Modulators4
4.2.3 ADSR - Modulator
An ADSR envelope has three time based elements, Attack, Decay and 
Release and one Sustain level. The ADSR also provides control over the 
time curve shapes.
Action Buttons
Select                ê€† ê€‡ ê€ˆ Trig                  ê€‰
Open the modulator 
selection pop-up list.
Manually triggers the 
envelope. Release 
stage starts when 
button is lifted.
ADSR1 120.0 ê€“ ê€‘ê€
ATTACK DECAY SUSTAIN RELEASE
ATTCURVE DECCURVE RELCURVE SPREAD
TRIGê€† ê€ˆê€‡ ê€‰SELECT
Mod
Page 1/1
Press [MATERIAL] to select and cycle pagesParameter Knobs                                                                                           Page 1

the envelope in 
seconds.

of the envelope in

Adjusts the attack 
phase shape.

phase shape.

phase shape.

and phase of the dual

Hold [MOD] + Press Action Button to select modulator
Press [MOD] to select modulation mode on or off when 
on a destination parameter page.

--- PAGE 88 ---

88 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
NOTES
Modulators4
An envelope is used for notes or beats to establish its contour over time, 
often as a one shot for example when pressing a note key. The S-4 ADSR 
is a traditional envelope but with extra features.
The ADSR modulator also allows the curve of the three Attack, Decay and 
Release time based elements of the envelope to be adjusted. This adds an 
extra level of sound shaping control.
Spread duplicates the envelope and creates a stereo-like effect based on 
the phase difference adjusted between the two envelopes.
Triggering the Envelope
There are two ways to trigger the envelope:
1. By pressing the [TRIG], ê€‰ Action button.
2. From an incoming MIDI Note on the tracks MIDI Channel.
In both cases a trigger will initiate the Attack stage and the ADSR release 
stage will commence when the trigger is lifted. 
Attack Decay Release
Sustain
Attcurve
Relcurve
Spread
Deccurve
Note On
Trigger On
TRIG
Note Off
Trigger Off
level
Secs Secs Secs

--- PAGE 89 ---

89The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
NOTES
Modulators4

--- PAGE 90 ---

90 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual

--- PAGE 91 ---

91The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
All four tracks of the S-4 are combined at the master output stage 
which is the final audio stage in a project. The Master output consists 
of 4 DJ style filters, one for each tracks audio output, then a master 
mixer to set the final gain levels and pan settings and lastly a master 
compressor. As with tracks, audio is handled in stereo. The master 
output functions are found in the mixer pages accessed with the 
dedicated â€˜MIXâ€™ button. The four tracks can be muted and also a 
master output audio file can be recorded from within the mix function. 
It is also important to note that the main output level can be controlled 
using the (SELECT) encoder when the mix page is active and visible.
Master Mix
5

--- PAGE 92 ---

92 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Master Mix5
NOTES5.1 Master Mix Overview
The master output functions can be found in the â€˜Mixâ€™ section. This is 
accessible with the dedicated [MIX] button.
Mix Button

Press the button again to cycle through 
the available mixer pages.
Press [MIX] to open master mixer

--- PAGE 93 ---

93The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Master Mix5
NOTES
â–Œ SELECTING THE MASTER MIX
1. Press [MIX] to open the master mixer. Press again to cycle to the next 
page. Page 1 has the track level mix and LP/HP filter cutoff. Page 2 has 
the pan for each track as well as the common compressor and master 
output level control. 
2. The respective parameter value knob will adjust the displayed value.
3. To mute a track, Press [MUTE] action button for the desired track to 
mute. Press the action button again to unmute the track.
4. To adjust the master output volume, Select MIX Page 2, Turn (SELECT) 
or Parameter Value Knob 6.
Parameter Knobs                                                                                          Page 1
Level Level Level Level 
Adjusts track 1 level. Adjusts track 2 level. Adjusts track 3 level. Adjusts track 4 level. 
Sets the gain level of the incoming audio
Filter Filter Filter Filter 
Track 1 Filter Cutoff Track 2 Filter Cutoff Track 3 Filter Cutoff Track 4 Filter Cutoff
Adjusts the DJ style filter for incoming audio
Parameter Knobs                                                                                          Page 2
Pan Pan Pan Pan 
Track 1 Pan Track 2 Pan Track 3 Pan Track 4 Pan
Adjusts the panorama left / right of the track audio in the mix.
Compress Main
Amount of  
compression applied 
to the main output.
Adjusts the level of 
the main output. 

--- PAGE 94 ---

94 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Master Mix5
NOTES
The master output sums all 4 tracks and allows mixing and control of the 
final audio stage of the project. Note that the USB also allows 10 Audio 
Inputs and 10 Outputs e.g. for a DAW interface. This will cover 4 stereo 
tracks and 1 stereo master output.

--- PAGE 95 ---

95The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Master Mix5
NOTES 5.2 Master Output Level
The main volume is the master output stage which adjusts the overall 
output level after all processing and mixing is complete. This is the final 
audio stage in the S-4.
â–Œ ADJUSTING THE MAIN OUTPUT LEVEL
1. For quick adjustment of main volume, Press [MIX] then Turn (SELECT).
2. The alternate method for volume adjustment is in the mix pages.
â€¢ Press [MIX] to open the master mixer. Press again to cycle to the 
next page, Page 2. 
â€¢ To adjust the master output volume, Turn (SELECT) or Parameter 
Value Knob 6 while displaying the Mix Page 2.
â€¢ To quickly reset the master out level, Hold [CLEAR] + Turn or Press 
the Main Level Parameter Knob 8 when in MIX Page 2.
Quick Volume Adjust 
mix
This is the quick volume level adjust method. The 
main out is also accessible in the Mixer Page 2.
Press [MIX] & Turn (SELECT)
Press Turn

--- PAGE 96 ---

96 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Master Mix5
NOTES5.3 Track Muting
The 4 track channels are represented in the main mixer where levels and 
panning can be adjusted. In addition each track channel can be individually 
muted or unmuted in the main mix.
â–Œ MUTING AUDIO TRACKS IN THE MIXER
1. Select the main mix page, Press [MIX].
2. Press the appropriate action button to Mute or Unmute the track.
â€¢ Press [MUTE 1] for Track 1 shown by the ê€†  symbol
â€¢ Press [MUTE 2] for Track 2 shown by the ê€‡  symbol.
â€¢ Press [MUTE 3] for Track 3 shown by the ê€ˆ  symbol.
â€¢ Press [MUTE 4] for Track 4 shown by the ê€‰  symbol.
â€¢ Press a muted track to unmute.
3. The muted track is displayed with a highlighted action button and 
labelled suggestion available mute / unmute option. Others will display 
as normal. 
Mute Track Channels 
Tracks are muted or unmuted on each press of 
the action button. The button screen label is 
highlighted when muted.

--- PAGE 97 ---

97The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Master Mix5
NOTES 5.4 DJ Style Filters
A DJ Style filter is available for each of the 4 tracks. The filters operate with  
integrated Low Pass and High Pass Filtering. The filters allow control of the 
filter cutoff as a performance and mixing feature.
ATTENUATION
FREQUENCY
HP LP
20Hz 20KHz
ATTENUATION
FREQUENCY
LP
20Hz 20KHz
ATTENUATION
FREQUENCY
HP
20Hz 20KHz
Filter Value at â€˜0â€™ Central. No Filtering, All Audio Passes
0
0
0
+100
+100
+100
-100
-100
-100
Filter Value at â€˜0 to +100%â€™ Applies High Pass Filtering
Filter Value at â€˜0 to -100%â€™ Applies Low Pass Filtering

--- PAGE 98 ---

98 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Master Mix5
NOTES
â–Œ ADJUSTING THE TRACK DJ STYLE FILTERS
1. Press [MIX] to open the master mixer. Each of the 4 track filters are 
located on Page 1. 
2. To adjust a filter cutoff and attenuate either the high or the low 
frequency bands for each chosen track:-
â€¢ Turn the Parameter knobs 5, 6, 7 and/or 8 to adjust the cutoff 
frequency point for each track. The control is bi-polar.
â€¢ Turn clockwise to adjust the range 0% to +100%. The bar indicator 
will adjust to the right. This adjusts the high pass filter cutoff. High 
pass attenuates frequencies below the cutoff point.
â€¢ Turn clockwise to adjust the range 0% to -100%. The bar indicator 
will adjust to the left. This adjusts the low pass filter cutoff. Low pass 
attenuates frequencies above the cutoff point.
3. To quickly restore the cutoff to the default â€˜0â€™ position and allow all audio 
to pass through, Hold [CLEAR] + Turn or Press the designated track 
filter value knob 5-8. Alternatively manually adjust the parameter value 
knobs.

--- PAGE 99 ---

99The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Master Mix5
NOTES 5.5 Master Compression
The audio mixed from the 4 tracks is passed to a common master 
compressor as the final effect stage. Compression is a common function at 
or near the end of an audio chain used to tame and control audio peaks 
and help add punch through control of perceived loudness. The S-4 has a 
single compressor control to adjust the amount of compression applied 
integrating functions such as make up gain, ratio and threshold.
â–Œ ADJUSTING THE MASTER COMPRESSOR
1. The compression settings are usually something that would be adjusted 
at the end of a project, prior to final mix down.
2. Press [MIX] to open the master mixer. The compressor option is located 
on Page 2. Press [MIX] to change pages.
3. Turn the (COMPRESS) Value Knob 6. Adjust in small increments while 
monitoring the audio. Take care not to increase too much especially if 
listening through headphones.
4. If required, Hold [CLEAR] + Turn or Press (COMPRESS) to restore a 
default â€˜0â€™ setting to the compression value.
Audio Over Time
Threshold
Ratio
Gain Reduction
Make Up
Master Output Compressor

--- PAGE 100 ---

100 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Master Mix5
NOTES5.6 Recording the Main Output
The ability to record the main mix as a single audio stem is possible from 
within the mix page. The recording option is found on page 2 of the action 
buttons, accessed by holding [CTRL].
Recording the Main Mix Audio 
Any audio passed out to the main mix will be 
recorded as a single audio file.
Record count is shown in the header while recording. 
Files are stored in the S-4 Storage Memory;
Location: /samples/recordings
Filename: S4_MainOut__x.WAV
Hold [CTRL] + [REC MAIN]
MIXï¿½ 120.0 ê€“ ê€ê€
PAN PAN PAN PAN
COMPRESS MAIN
REC MAINê€† ê€ˆê€‡ ê€‰
1 2 3 4
MIX 120.000.04 ê€“ ê€ê€
PAN PAN PAN PAN
COMPRESS MAIN
MUTE MUTE MUTE MUTEê€† ê€ˆê€‡ ê€‰
1 2 3 4
ï¿½

--- PAGE 101 ---

101The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Master Mix5
NOTES
â–Œ RECORDING THE MAIN MIX
1. Select the main mix page, Press [MIX].
2. Play the tracks that are required in the main mix. Mute any tracks if 
audio is not required in the mix.
3. Hold [CTRL] + Press [REC MAIN], ê€‰  action button to start recording. 
The button will be highlighted when recording.
4. Recording is performed in real time and the elapsed time duration will 
be displayed while recording in the screen header.
5. Hold [CTRL] + Press [REC MAIN], ê€‰  action button to stop recording. 
Maximum recording time based on the available S-4 memory with no 
defined duration.
6. The recording will be stored automatically when the recording ends. 
The file will be saved in the on board storage memory within the 
samples / recordings folder and will be named in the file list with a 
sequential number â€˜xâ€™: S-4_MainOut__x.WAV.

--- PAGE 102 ---

102 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual

--- PAGE 103 ---

103The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
6
Managing and capturing audio into the S-4 can be an important option 
as part of the sound design process, as interfacing with other audio 
gear expands the creative possibilities. The S-4 offers multiple 
interface options for audio. One option is to use the â€˜In 1â€™ and â€˜In 2â€™ line 
inputs by connecting to the rear panel. In addition an internal 
microphone offers a quick and easy way to capture surrounding audio 
immediately on the fly. Also an external headset can be used which 
has integrated headphones and microphone. This would need to have 
a 4-Pole TRRS 3.5mm Mini Jack and be connected to the Headphone 
jack. The USB interface also provides audio functionality and connects 
both as a host or as a device. Interfacing to a PC / Mac Digital Audio 
Workstation can be performed directly across the USB audio function 
where 10 Inputs and 10 Outputs are presented. This covers all 4 
stereo tracks in the S-4 along with the master out stereo signal. The 
S-4 operates at 24-bit / 48 kHz stereo audio in and out and will 
recognise .wav and .flac sample formats. Samples can be stored on 
board the 4GB memory. In addition the S-4 can also operate with an 
external USB drive when connected to access user samples.
Audio In & Out

--- PAGE 104 ---

104 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Audio In & Out6
NOTES6.1 Audio Connectivity
The physical connections for the audio inputs and outputs are located on 
the rear panel of the S-4 device.

sync outmidi out

is located on the S-4 rear panel.
Two dedicated, mono line level outputs 
are located on the S-4 rear panel.
Output is a TRS 3.5mm / 1/8th
Inch Stereo Jack socket.
A Headset with microphone 
can be used if plugged into the 
headphone out.
A headset needs a TRRS 
3.5mm / 1/8th Inch jack for 
stereo out and mic in.
Out 1 - Left
Out 2 - Right
Outputs are TR 6.35mm / 1/4 Inch 
Mono Jack sockets.
Output volume level for headphones 
replicates the main output.
Output can be connected to a mixer, audio interface, 
powered monitors or other audio synths, effects and gear.

Line Input and output options provide analog audio connections for the S-4. 
USB can be used for digital connectivity when used with compatible gear.

Two dedicated, mono line level inputs 
are located on the S-4 rear panel.
Inputs are TR 6.35mm / 1/4 Inch 
Mono Jack sockets.
External line level gear such as synths and effects can be 
connected for audio inputs. Note that Eurorack operates to 
a higher audio level than line level and may need the gain 
attenuating before and/or in the S-4 to operate effectively.

--- PAGE 106 ---

106 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Audio In & Out6
NOTES6.2 Internal Microphone
The S-4 contains a in-built microphone, located on the top panel near the 
main select control. This is a quick and simple way to capture raw ambient 
audio, found sounds, voice or even taps and vibrations on the S-4 case.
â–Œ CONFIGURING AND SELECTING THE MIC INPUT
1. Press [CONFIG] to open the configuration settings.
2. Turn (SELECT) to navigate to select the â€˜AUDIOâ€™ option. Also press the 
[DOWN], ê€‡ or [UP], ê€ˆ Action buttons to navigate the menu.
3. Press [OPEN], ê€†  or Press (SELECT) to open the audio sub-menu.
4. Navigate to highlight the â€˜INPUT MODEâ€™ option.
5. Turn any of the 8 parameter knobs to adjust the setting. Alternatively, 
Press [OPEN] to cycle the available options.  
â€¢ LINE: Audio Line Inputs In 1 / In 2.
â€¢ MIC. Microphone. Front panel access to mic. Select This Option
â€¢ HEADSET. Connected TRRS headset microphone.
6. The microphone audio input gain can also be adjusted. Navigate to 
highlight the â€˜MIC GAINâ€™ option and Turn any of the 8 parameter knobs 
to adjust the setting. Also applies to headset mic.
7. The microphone can now be used within the material Tape device. 
Audio can be recorded from the internal microphone into a tape. It is 
good practice to keep mic gain turned low when not in use. 
Internal Microphone.
Capture external surrounding audio.
Microphone.
[Config] > Audio Settings.
power usb
project config
AUDIOï¿½
MIC GAIN 56.0%
INPUT MODE MIC
SELECTê€† ê€ˆê€‡ ê€‰ BACK

--- PAGE 107 ---

107The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Audio In & Out 6
NOTES 6.3 Managing the Line Inputs
The line inputs of the S-4 are routed into the material device slot. This 
means that the incoming audio can be used as the input to the tape device 
or as a live input signal when the device is set to Bypass.  If the track input 
configuration is set to â€˜Sends Only. The line and mic audio are ignored and 
only audio from sends is used.
â–Œ SETTING UP THE LINE IN FOR TRACKS
1. Press [CONFIG] to open the configuration settings.
2. Turn (SELECT) to navigate to select the â€˜AUDIOâ€™ option. Also press the 
[DOWN], ê€‡ or [UP], ê€ˆ Action buttons to navigate the menu.
3. Press [OPEN], ê€†  or Press (SELECT) to open the audio sub-menu.
4. Navigate to highlight the â€˜INPUT MODEâ€™ option.
5. Turn any of the 8 parameter knobs to adjust the setting. Alternatively, 
Press [OPEN] to cycle the available options.  
â€¢ LINE: Audio Line Inputs In 1 / In 2. Select This Option
â€¢ MIC. Microphone. Internally front panel access to mic.
â€¢ HEADSET. Connected headset and integrated microphone.
Track 1   LINE IN        BYPASS
Track 2   LINE IN        BYPASS
Track 3   LINE IN        BYPASS
Line Inputs
Track 4   LINE IN        BYPASS
Track Mixer
Track Mixer
Track Mixer
Track Mixer
Tape
Tape
Material
Material
AUDIOï¿½
MIC GAIN 50.0%
INPUT MODE LINE
SELECTê€† ê€ˆê€‡ ê€‰ BACK

--- PAGE 108 ---

108 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
Audio In & Out6
NOTES6.4 Audio over USB
The S-4 has a class compliant USB interface with an extended array of 10 
Audio Inputs and 10 Audio Outputs.  The S-4 can be connected to 
compatible audio gear as host or device using the USB-C connector and 
will be identified as â€˜S-4â€™ in the external devices interface configuration.
Audio Channel Output Assignments.
Routed from each individual track plus the main combined mix output to the USB channels. 
Audio Channel Input Assignments.
Routed and mixed into each of the stereo tracks along with existing internal audio 
including any line input audio.
Channel Audio Track Description
1 Mono All Tracks Main Audio Output - Left
2 Mono All Tracks Main Audio Output - Right

5 / 6 Stereo Track 2 Track Output - Left & Right
7 / 8 Stereo Track 3 Track Output - Left & Right
9 / 10 Stereo Track 4 Track Output - Left & Right

audio for the respective track. Audio can be sent out 
or received in simultaneously over USB.

Audio In & Out 6
Example: Interfacing USB audio In/out of S-4 and in/out of iPad using AUM
The S-4 is connected to a iPad with the USB cable. The example illustrates iPad settings for the 
AUM App. AUM is an app which manages integration of iOS audio apps and external audio and 
MIDI gear. Connect the S-4 and iPad, maybe an interface is needed, then power up the S-4.

MSXII Fly Tape
Plug-in effect in the audio chain
Audiokit Retro Piano
Plug-in Audio instrument 
Channels to transmit audio from the iPad out 
to the S-4 via the USB interface connection
1 Channel to receive audio from the S-4 main 
out to the iPad via the USB interface connection
Various iPad iOS apps as Audio Unit extensions or interfaced devices on the iPad through AUM can be used as audio sources 
on the iPad. The example shows Retro Piano with an inline FlyTape effect. The Audio is processed in the S-4 and the main out 
returned to the iPad for recording or other audio capture or processing within AUM.

--- PAGE 112 ---

112 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual

--- PAGE 113 ---

113The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
7
MIDI or Musical Instrument Digital Interface is a standard protocol for 
communicating between audio devices.  The S-4 can communicate 
MIDI across the dedicated MIDI in and out ports and also using the 
USB-C connection. Each of the 4 tracks can be controlled on 
individually dedicated MIDI Channels. The MIDI In and Out uses a 
TRS Type A, 3.5mm Jack to MIDI DIN adapter. An adapter is supplied 
with the S-4. MIDI allows the S-4 to be played by notes from an 
external MIDI Keyboard or from an external sequencer. In addition to 
the digital interface of MIDI, two analog connections also exist. The 
Sync In and Out will be available in a future update for connecting to 
analog gear and to / from Eurorack modules. 
MIDI Sync and Analog Sync Functions are not included in release 1.0 
of the S-4 Firmware. They will be implemented in the first update 
coming soon. MIDI Channels and CC can be assigned.
MIDI & Sync

--- PAGE 114 ---

114 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
MIDI & Sync7
NOTES7.1 MIDI Connectivity
The physical connections for the MIDI inputs and outputs are located on the 
rear panel of the S-4 device.
5 Pin DIN MIDI In / Out
torso
electronics
S-4
in 1out 1
sync inmidi in
usbin 2out 2
sync outmidi out
Two dedicated MIDI connections are located on the S-4 rear 
panel for connecting 3.5mm to 5 Pin Type A Adapters.
ARTURIA

A Standard 5 Pin DIN MIDI cable 
can be connected via the adapter.
Set the S-4 and the external device to 
the same MIDI Channel i.e. Channel 1.
A MIDI Controller for example a keyboard or sequencer can 
be connected to the S-4 by the MIDI Input.

NOTES
USB also offers a MIDI interface to connect other gear. Ensure the USB 
cable is specified for data communication. 
Set the S-4 and the external device to 
the same MIDI Channel i.e. Channel 1.
USB MIDI In / Out
MIDI In Indicator
The USB-C Connection also allows interfacing to other gear, 
PC/Mac DAWâ€™s and controllers.
Any MIDI data received into the S-4 is indicated by the MIDI Symbol located in the 
top right of the page. This icon will flash when MIDI data is received.
The T-1 Sequencer is a perfect companion for the S-4. The 
USB-C S-4 Connection will also supply power to the T-1.

1211109
7.2 MIDI Channel
To communicate between the two connected devices the MIDI channel 
must be set to the same channel on each. Check with the manufacturers 
documentation for any external device MIDI configuration. Each track of 
the S-4 can be configured to receive MIDI on its own individual channel.
â–Œ ADJUSTING THE S-4 MIDI CHANNEL
1. Connect devices using the USB or MIDI ports.
2. Press [CONFIG] to open the configuration settings.
3. Turn (SELECT) to navigate to select the track to edit. Also press the 
[DOWN], ê€‡ or [UP], ê€ˆ Action buttons to navigate the menu.
4. Press [OPEN], ê€†  or Press (SELECT) to open the track sub-menu.
5. Navigate to highlight the â€˜MIDI CHANNELâ€™ option.
6. Turn any of the 8 parameter knobs to set the MIDI channel or tap 
[OPEN] to cycle channels. Set to the same channel as the external 
device, example Channel 1. 
MIDI Channels 1-16
T-1 Algorithmic Sequencer
S-4 Sculpting Sampler
TRACK 1ï¿½

--- PAGE 117 ---

117The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
MIDI & Sync 7
NOTES 7.3 MIDI Synchronisation
The S-4 can be synchronised to an external MIDI Clock. This will then take 
over the global tempo BPM of the S-4 device. A clock can also be sent from 
the S-4 to synchronise other gear to the S-4. Also the S-4 can respond to 
external transport controls to start and stop playback of the tracks.
MIDI Config Settings [CONFIG] > MIDI 
CONFIGï¿½
TRACK 1ê€†
ê€‡
ê€ˆ
ê€‰
ï¿½
TRACK 2
TRACK 3
TRACK 4
MIDI
AUDIO
SYSTEM
MISC
OPENê€† ê€ˆê€‡ ê€‰ BACK
ï¿½
ï¿½
ï¿½
MIDIï¿½
CC CONTROL ï¿½
SYNC OUT ï¿½
SYNC OUT ï¿½
START/STOP ï¿½
SELECTê€† ê€ˆê€‡ ê€‰ BACK
Menu Setting Option Description
MIDI CC Control Sets the S-4 to receive MIDI CC - Continuous Control 
Change messages.
MIDI Sync In MIDI synchronization of clock. Sync In is ON for S-4 
clock control from an external device.
MIDI Sync Out MIDI synchronization of clock. Sync Out is ON for 
external clock control from the S-4 device.
MIDI Start / Stop MIDI synchronization of transport. Start / Stop is ON to 
control the playback of the S-4 from an external device. 

--- PAGE 118 ---

118 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
MIDI & Sync7
NOTES
â–Œ SETTING UP MIDI SYNC FOR EXTERNAL GEAR 
1. Ensure S-4 is connected to another MIDI device and the MIDI channels 
are aligned to the same.
2. Decide on which device will be the primary lead and which will be a 
secondary follower.
3. Use the action button navigation or the (SELECT) Knob to scroll to the 
desired option to change. To toggle the option On / Checked or Off / 
Unchecked turn any of the 8 parameter knobs or tap [SELECT].
â€¢ CC CONTROL : On / Off. When On the S-4 will receive external CC 
messages in order to control defined parameters.
â€¢ SYNC IN : On / Off. When On an external device can be used to 
control the clock. The S-4 and its global tempo will respond to the 
timing of the external clock. Manual tempo adjustments using the 
(SELECT) knob will be ignored when Sync In is On and will be 
available when Sync In is Off.
â€¢ SYNC OUT : On / Off. When On an external device will respond to 
the S-4 clock. The S-4 global tempo will be used by the external 
device. Manual tempo adjustments using the (SELECT) knob will be 
available when Sync In is Off and and external clock is used when 
Sync In is On.
â€¢ START / STOP : On - The S-4 recognises and acts upon the 
incoming start / stop commands from the connected MIDI Device 
sending transport. This will control the Play/Stop tracks button. 
When off the S-4 Transport will be independently controlled by the 
Play/Stop button.
power in 1 out 1 sync in midi inusb in 2 out 2 sync out midi out

mod track mix
copy ctrl

scene perform

Channel 1
T-1 will control the S-4 Playback. For example the sequencer will trigger the 
Poly. Tracks will play/stop from T-1 Transport control.
S-4 Follower

--- PAGE 119 ---

119The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
MIDI & Sync 7
NOTES 7.4 MIDI CC
MIDI Continuous Control Change Messages, also shortened to CC, are 
used in the S-4 to control parameters from external gear. CC Messages are 
mapped using a specific CC number. Parameter changes are then 
communicated over a value range of 0-127 which then affects the 
destination parameter value based on its own designated range. Typically 
an external MIDI controller knob or fader will control the S-4 parameter.
+-
CUTOFF
CUTOFF RELCURVE RATE
External MIDI Control
Examples
CC #79
96
96
75
75%
100%0%
0 127
0-127 input will be scaled 
across the destination range
For tracks, the MIDI channel is 
as set for the track. e.g Ch1
Set the CC Control to ON in the MIDI Config parameters in order to use external control
S-4 Filter Cutoff 
Example 0-100% 
Ranged parameter. 
75% 
Example -50/+50% 
Ranged parameter. 
+32%. 
Input from CC is 0-127
Example = 96
Example Selection 
ranged parameter. 
Range divided by # options. 
CC #79

Mix 16 57 Encoder 3 (P2) Pan 3
Mix 16 58 Encoder 4 (P2) Pan 4
Mix 16 59 Encoder 5 (P2) Compress
Mix 16 60 Encoder 6 (P2)
Mix 16 61 Encoder 7 (P2)
Mix 16 62 Encoder 8 (P2) Main Level

--- PAGE 127 ---

127The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
MIDI & Sync 7
7.5 Sync In / Out
The S-4 can be synchronised with an external analog clock. The S-4 can 
send or receive an analog clock at 24 PPQN using the rear Sync In and 
Sync Out connections. If multiple clocks are connected to S-4 the hierarchy 
dictates the primary lead clock used where the Sync In Analog clock is the 
highest in the order.
Pamâ€™s New Workout synchronised as the secondary follower to S-4 which is  the 
primary clock. Any subsequent connected devices to PNW will be synchronised. An 
output from PAMâ€™s could be used to synchronise the S-4 using itâ€™s Sync In as an 
option if the Eurorack is to operate as the primary clock.
1 2
Clock Sync Hierarchy
S-4 System
Analog Clock MIDI Clock
Sync In MIDI In
Pamâ€™s New Workout Eurorack Module:
â€¢ PPQN = 24 - Matches S-4 Default
â€¢ Run? = May need to be set off as there will be no 
trigger sent from the S-4 to PAMâ€™s.
Tempo will follow S-4
torso
electronics
S-4
in 1out 1
sync inmidi in
usbin 2out 2
sync outmidi out
3.5mm TR Mini Jacks can patch to 
or from an external analog clock.
Example: Synchronising Eurorack with PAMâ€™s from S-4.
NOTES

--- PAGE 128 ---

128 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual

--- PAGE 129 ---

129The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
8
This section covers all the elements of a non-creative nature and  
things that don't fit a sound design workflow. System based functions 
such as firmware updates and configuration settings are contained 
here along with housekeeping guidance. Some elements in the 
configuration settings are also covered in the appropriate section 
along with the relevant topic earlier in this manual. You could consider 
this the area for all the boring bits, but nevertheless there is is still 
useful and in fact important information contained within. As such it is 
worth at least familiarising with this section and its contents.
System

--- PAGE 130 ---

130 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
System8
8.1 Config Menu Options
Menu Setting Option Description
Track 1 Track Input
Sets the external line in audio mode for track 1. Select from Stereo, 
Mono L or Mono R and Sends Only options. Sends only excludes line 
and mic audio and only considers the send audio.
Track 1 MIDI Channel Sets the MIDI communication channel for Track 1 when communicating 
from externally connected devices. Select Channel 1-16.
Track 2 Track Input
Sets the external line in audio mode for track 1. Select from Stereo, 
Mono L or Mono R and Sends Only options. Sends only excludes line 
and mic audio and only considers the send audio.
Track 2 MIDI Channel Sets the MIDI communication channel for Track 2 when communicating 
from externally connected devices. Select Channel 1-16.
Track 3 Track Input
Sets the external line in audio mode for track 1. Select from Stereo, 
Mono L or Mono R and Sends Only options. Sends only excludes line 
and mic audio and only considers the send audio.
Track 3 MIDI Channel Sets the MIDI communication channel for Track 3 when communicating 
from externally connected devices. Select Channel 1-16.
Track 4 Track Input
Sets the external line in audio mode for track 1. Select from Stereo, 
Mono L or Mono R and Sends Only options. Sends only excludes line 
and mic audio and only considers the send audio.
Track 4 MIDI Channel Sets the MIDI communication channel for Track 4 when communicating 
from externally connected devices. Select Channel 1-16.
MIDI CC Control Allows external MIDI control over the S-4 parameters when ON. This 
allows external CC Messages to affect parameter values.
MIDI Sync In MIDI synchronization of clock. Sync In is ON for S-4 clock control from 
an external device.
MIDI Sync Out MIDI synchronization of clock. Sync Out is ON for external clock control 
from the S-4 device.
MIDI Start / Stop MIDI synchronization of transport. Start / Stop is ON to control the 
playback of the S-4 from an external device. 
Audio Mic Gain Adjust the gain applied to the microphone and headset mic input.
Audio Input Mode Select between the input to use between the rear line inputs, on board 
microphone or a connected headset microphone.
System Firmware Version * Displays the currently installed firmware version.
System Storage * Indicates the on board memory. The base memory is 4GB.
System USB Mass Storage Sets the S-4 into mass storage mode to allow access from a PC/Mac. 
The S-4 will be recognised as an external hard drive device.
System Install Update Initiate a firmware update. The firmware update file will be installed.
System Install Factory Samples Install a factory sample pack in the format applicable to S-4
Misc Display Brightness Adjusts the brightness of the screen display. 
 *  The function is an Indication only and cannot be edited directly in the menu.

--- PAGE 131 ---

131The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
System8
NOTES
â–Œ ACCESSING THE CONFIG MENU
1. Press [CONFIG] to open the configuration settings.
2. Turn (SELECT) to navigate to highlight the desired sub-menu. Also 
press the [DOWN], ê€‡ or [UP], ê€ˆ Action buttons to navigate the menu.
3. With a target sub menu highlighted, Press [OPEN], ê€†  or Press 
(SELECT) to open the options. Press [BACK], ê€‰ Action button to exit 
and backup the config menu structure.
4. To change a setting:-
â€¢ Turn any of the 8 Parameter knobs to change a selected option. 
â€¢ Tap [OPEN], ê€†  Action button to cycle through the available options.
5. Note some listings are only for information and display purposes and 
cannot be changed manually. For example, firmware version.

--- PAGE 132 ---

132 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
System8
NOTES8.2 Connecting the S-4 to a PC / Mac for Data Transfer
It is possible to connect and communicate with the S-4 from a PC/Mac 
using the USB-C connection. This is useful for a variety of reasons but one 
specific function is to transfer data to the S-4 as a remote storage device. 
Transferring samples and firmware updates can be performed in this mode.
â–Œ CONNECTING A PC/MAC
1. Ensure the S-4 is powered off.
2. Connect a compatible USB cable between the PC / Mac and the S-4 
USB-C connector. The cable will depend on the PC/Mac connections 
i.e. Type C or A etc. Ensure this is a fully functional USB data 
compatible cable and not designed only for use as a power cable.
3. Power ON the S-4 using the supplied PSU. This will need the dedicated 
PSU connected as the USB port does not power the S-4 device.
in 1out 1
sync inmidi in
usbin 2out 2
sync outmidi out
USB-C Interface.
Connect a USB cable between 
the S-4 and the PC/Mac.
PC / Mac connected with a 
compatible USB cable

--- PAGE 133 ---

133The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
System8
NOTES 8.3 S-4 as a Mass Storage Device
The S-4 can operate as a MSD or Mass Storage Device when connected to 
a PC or Mac. This presents the S-4 similar to a remote hard drive 
connected to the PC/Mac. This allows transfer of files by simply dragging 
from the PC/Mac to the S-4 MSD.
â–Œ SETTING S-4 AS A MASS STORAGE DEVICE
1. Connect the PC/Mac to the S-4 as previously described. Ensure any 
projects are saved on the S-4.
2. Press [CONFIG] to open the configuration settings.
3. Turn (SELECT) to navigate to highlight the â€˜SYSTEMâ€™ sub-menu. Also 
press the [DOWN], ê€‡ or [UP], ê€ˆ Action buttons to navigate the menu.
4. Press [OPEN], ê€†  or Press (SELECT) to open the sub-menu options.
5. Navigate to highlight the â€˜USB MASS STORAGEâ€™ option.
6. Press [OPEN], ê€† Action button or Press (SELECT) Knob to set the S-4 
to a Mass Storage Device. This means the S-4 will be presented on the 
PC/Mac like a removable hard drive and named â€˜S-4â€™. An error will be 
displayed if a USB connection is not present or is not recognised.
7. Files can be copied from the PC/Mac to / from the S-4 MSD. For 
example to copy a firmware file or a sample to the S-4 or use this mode 
to backup files from the S-4 to the PC/Mac.
8. When complete, eject the S-4 from the within the PC/Mac file browser.
9. The S-4 will be disconnected and will restart. 
Mass Storage Device
S-4
power in 1 out 1 sync in midi inusb in 2 out 2 sync out midi out
project
mod track mix
copy ctrl
temp
config
scene perform
clear

S-4 sculpting sampler

System8
NOTES
The S-4 can be backed up by copying the folders and files from the S-4 
when in mass storage device mode. User samples can also be transferred 
to the S-4 for use in the audio engines. The folder structure follows a 
defined convention. 
Root  Folder
/projects
/samples
/FACTORY
/BOUNCES

e.g. S4_MainOut__1.wav

or accessible on the S-4 MSD.
e.g. S4_Track2__1.wav
e.g. Project_1.s4project

--- PAGE 135 ---

135The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
System8
NOTES 8.4 Connecting an External USB Drive
It is possible to connect and access samples from an external drive 
connected to the USB Port. Drive must be formatted to either exFAT or 
FAT32 in order for it to be used with the S-4. The drive will be visible in the 
sample browser and will allow samples to be loaded to the relevant device. 
Samples cannot be copied from the flash drive to the S-4.
â–Œ CONNECTING AN EXTERNAL USB DRIVE
1. Ensure the S-4 is powered off.
2. Connect a USB Drive directly to the USB-C Connection. It is not 
recommended to connect via a hub. 
3. Power ON the S-4.
4. Press [LOAD], ê€† Action button from to access the sample loader, for 
example from the Tape Device main page.
5. The External Drive will appear in the browser along with the user and 
factory sample folder. This can be navigated in the same manner as 
other folders. Use (SELECT) or navigation buttons.
6. To eject the drive navigate to highlight the â€˜USB Driveâ€™, then Hold 
[CTRL] + [EJECT], ê€† Action button. The drive can now be physically 
disconnected from the S-4.
Hold [CTRL] + Press [EJECT]
to eject the drive from S-4
1TB
torso
electronics
S-4
in 1out 1
sync inmidi in
usbin 2out 2
sync outmidi out
USB-C Interface.
Connect a USB drive to the S-4.
SAMPLE BROWSERï¿½

/

--- PAGE 136 ---

136 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
System8
NOTES8.5 Firmware Update of the S-4
From time to time Torso Electronics will release firmware updates. This may 
be to kill any bug issues or to add or enhance the S-4 features. The defined 
process for updates should follow the specific instructions supplied with the 
firmware, otherwise this acts as a generic guide. Update can also be 
installed from an external USB drive.
â–Œ FIRMWARE UPDATE
1. Download the firmware version from the Torso Electronics website.
2. Connect the PC/Mac to the S-4 with the USB Cable and set as a MSD-
Mass Storage Device as described previously. The S-4 should appear 
on the PC/Mac as a disk.
3. Copy the downloaded firmware .ZIP image from your PC/Mac to the S-4 
mass storage device. Ensure this is an intact .ZIP file and has not been 
unzipped automatically in the browser.
4. Eject the "S-4" disk on your computer
5. On the S-4, Press [CONFIG] to open the settings menu.
6. Turn (SELECT) to navigate to highlight the â€˜SYSTEMâ€™ sub-menu. Also 
press the [DOWN], ê€‡ or [UP], ê€ˆ Action buttons to navigate the menu.
7. Press [OPEN], ê€†  or Press (SELECT) to open the system sub-menu.
8. Navigate to highlight the â€˜INSTALL UPDATEâ€™ option.
9. Press [OPEN], ê€† Action button or Press (SELECT) Knob to install the 
firmware previously located on the mass storage device
10. The update will commence and the display screen will illustrate the 
progress as the file transfers and installs.
11. Once complete the S-4 will restart with the new operating system 
firmware installed. The current firmware version will be displayed in the 
start up splash screen. The update file is automatically deleted from the 
S-4 mass storage device.
ê€€
V1.0.0

--- PAGE 137 ---

137The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
System8
NOTES 8.6 Installing Factory Samples
Adding user samples is a case of dragging and dropping the correct sample 
format from a PC/Mac to the Samples/USER directory when the S-4 is set 
as a mass storage device. Sub folders can be created. The S-4 will come 
loaded with a set of factory samples. If there is a need to reinstall these or 
any updated factory samples, a system utility will help install into the correct 
categories. Update can also be installed from an external USB drive.
â–Œ FACTORY SAMPLES UPDATE
1. Download the factory samples latest version from the Torso Electronics 
website. 
2. Connect the PC/Mac to the S-4 with the USB Cable and set as a MSD-
Mass Storage Device as described previously. The S-4 should appear 
on the PC/Mac as a disk.
3. Copy the downloaded zip file on your PC/Mac to the S-4 mass storage 
device. Ensure this is an intact .ZIP file and has not been automatically 
unzipped in the browser.
4. Eject the "S-4" disk on your computer
5. On the S-4, Press [CONFIG] to open the settings menu.
6. Turn (SELECT) to navigate to highlight the â€˜SYSTEMâ€™ sub-menu. Also 
press the [DOWN], ê€‡ or [UP], ê€ˆ Action buttons to navigate the menu.
7. Press [OPEN], ê€†  or Press (SELECT) to open the system sub-menu.
8. Navigate to highlight the â€˜INSTALL FACTORY SAMPLESâ€™ option.
9. Press [OPEN], ê€† Action button or Press (SELECT) Knob to install the 
samples previously located on the mass storage device.
10. The installation will commence and the display screen will illustrate the 
progress as the file transfers and installs.
11. Once complete the S-4 will restart with the new factory samples 
installed. These will be found when loading a sample in the â€˜Factoryâ€™ 
folder ordered by theme.

--- PAGE 138 ---

138 The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
System8
NOTES8.7 Display Brightness
The display brightness can be adjusted within the â€˜MISCâ€™ configuration. 
â–Œ ADJUSTING THE DEVICE DISPLAY BRIGHTNESS
1. Press [CONFIG] to open the configuration settings.
2. Turn (SELECT) to navigate to highlight the â€˜MISCâ€™ sub-menu. Also 
press the [DOWN], ê€‡ or [UP], ê€ˆ Action buttons to navigate the menu.
3. Press [OPEN], ê€†  or Press (SELECT) to open the sub-menu options.
4. Navigate to highlight the â€˜DISPLAY BRIGHTNESSâ€™ option.
5. Press [OPEN], ê€† Action button to toggle the setting value or turn any of 
the 8 parameter knobs. The display will adjust real time while the 
changes are being made.
MISCï¿½
DISPLAY BRIGHTNESS    15
OPENê€† ê€ˆê€‡ ê€‰ BACK

--- PAGE 139 ---

139The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
System8
NOTES 8.8 Power Considerations
The S-4 is powered from a dedicated power supply and is not in itself 
powered by the USB port. Portable power chargers can be used and also 
the S-4 can power other devices from its USB port. It is impossible to give 
details for each connected device but there are some generic elements to 
consider.
â€¢ S4 stand alone power and general consumption:  1A, 12V (12 Watt)
â€¢ S4 powering a connected Torso Electronics T-1: 1.2A, 12V (14.4 Watt)
â€¢ S4 + max current draw from USB port: 1.5A, 12V (18 Watt)
â€¢ The current limit for powering external devices via S-4â€™s USB is 1A, 5V.

electronics
S-4

9.1 Scales
Some scales are applied to various functions in the S-4 typically to quantize 
the pitch to a note in the scale. A selectable â€˜Freeâ€™ option is not quantized to 
any scale. The scales covered in various functions are illustrated below.

A summary of all destination parameters which can be modulated is 
provided below. The modulation sources can be any modulator assigned to 
Mod 1, Mod 2, Mod 3 or Mod 4 slot.

Appendix9
Currently the S-4 can modulate all of the adjustable parameters found in 
the audio devices, tracks and the main mix page. Note that the amount of 
modulation can be applied unipolar or bipolar. in [MOD] mode change mode 
adjustment using [CTRL] + Parameter.

145The S-4 Sculpting Sampler - Official Manual
9.3 Timing Rate Options
Some functions operate on a timing scale i.e. all rates and delay time. 
These note divisions are shown generally below. The rates available 
include triplet and dotted values.
Vast: Starts at 4/1 up to 1/64 for Straight, Triplet and Dotted. Free is 10000ms - 2.7ms
Ring: Starts at 32/1 up to 1/64 for Straight, Triplet and Dotted. Free is 0.20Hz - 50Hz
Random: Starts at 8/1 up to 1/64 for Straight, Triplet and Dotted. Free is 0.20Hz - 50Hz
Wave: Starts at 32/1 up to 1/64 for Straight, Triplet and Dotted. Free is 0.20Hz - 50Hz
Mode Rate Division Options Comments
Straight 32/1, 16/1, 8/1, 4/1, 2/1, 1/1, 1/2, 1/4, 1/8, 1/16, 1/32, 1/64 Division Values
Triplet 32/1 T, 16/1 T, 8/1 T, 4/1 T, 2/1 T, 1/1 T, Â½ T, Â¼ T, 1/8 T, 1/16 T, 
1/32 T, 1/64 T Division Values
Dotted 32/1 D, 16/1 D, 8/1 D, 8/1 D, 4/1 D, 2/1 D, 1/1 D, 1/2 D, 1/4 D, 
1/8 D, 1/16 D, 1/32 D, 1/64 D Division Values
Free 0.20Hz - 50Hz, Vast: 10000ms - 2.7ms Adjust Freely
